title: limmi
text: data https://www.fil.ion.ucl.ac.uk/spm/data/face_rfx/. data study Henson, R. N. ., et al. “Face repetition effects implicit explicit memory tests measured fMRI.” Cerebral Cortex 12.2 (2002): 178-186. included subset data inst/extdata/ directory (can contrast):
code: tarfile = system.file("extdata", "can.tar.gz", package = "limmi") # tarfile exdir = tempfile() dir.create(exdir) files = untar(tarfile = tarfile, list = TRUE, exdir = exdir) files = files[!grepl("^\\.", basename(files))] unz = untar(tarfile = tarfile, files = files, exdir = exdir) files = files[ grepl("hdr", basename(files))] # files files = file.path(exdir, files)

title: limmi
text: use nifti_images_to_matrix function read images matrix: Let’s read one images look contrast images:  can also look mean image voxels:  Now, run limma directly matrix. nifti_limma function wrapper process. likely mask file voxels want perform operation, otherwise work voxels, even NaN regions. Let’s make mask voxels non-missing data:
code: mat = nifti_images_to_matrix(files, verbose = FALSE) attr(mat, "image_dim") #> [1] 53 63 46 attr(mat, "image_pixdim") #> [1] 3 3 3 dim(mat) #> [1] 153594     12 img = asNifti(files[[1]]) have_neurobase = requireNamespace("neurobase", quietly = TRUE) pdim = c(3, pixdim(img), rep(1, 4)) if (have_neurobase) {   neurobase::ortho2(img, pdim = pdim) } mask = array(TRUE, dim = dim(img)) mean_image = limmi:::remake_nifti_image(rowMeans(mat), img, mask = mask >0) if (have_neurobase) {   neurobase::ortho2(mean_image, pdim = pdim) } keep = rowSums(!is.na(mat)) > 0 mask = array(keep, dim = dim(img)) mask = asNifti(mask, reference = img) if (have_neurobase) {   neurobase::ortho2(mask, pdim = pdim) }

title: limmi
text: Now mask want, let’s run limma linear fit:

title: limmi
text: can use nifti_lmFit function perform one function:
code: check_fit = nifti_lmFit(imgs = files, mask = mask, verbose = FALSE) all.equal(check_fit$coefficients, fit$coefficients) #> [1] TRUE

title: limmi
text: Let’s run eBayes defaults (likely good idea data), getting results:
code: eb = limma::eBayes(fit = fit) coef_vec = eb$coefficients[,1] coef_image = limmi:::remake_nifti_image(coef_vec, img, mask = mask > 0) if (have_neurobase) {   neurobase::double_ortho(mean_image, coef_image, pdim = pdim) }

title: limmi
text: nifti_eBayes function reading, fitting, eBayes:   output nifti_eBayes remaking images, images element list output images eBayes:  Meanwhile, nifti_eBayes computes standard T statistics associated p-value:  default, nifti_eBayes also topTable limma adjust p-values, using Benjamini-Hochberg adjustment:  can compare two maps, adjustment:
code: check_eb = nifti_eBayes(files, mask, verbose = FALSE) all.equal(check_eb$empirical_bayes$coefficients, eb$coefficients) #> [1] TRUE diff_from_mean = mean_image - coef_image if (have_neurobase) {   neurobase::ortho2(diff_from_mean, pdim = pdim) } hist(diff_from_mean) if (have_neurobase) {   neurobase::ortho2(check_eb$images$p.value, pdim = pdim) } if (have_neurobase) {   neurobase::ortho2(check_eb$images$standard_t_stat_p_val, pdim = pdim) } if (have_neurobase) {   neurobase::ortho2(check_eb$images$adjusted_p_value, pdim = pdim)   neurobase::ortho2(check_eb$images$adjusted_p_value <= 0.05, pdim = pdim) } if (have_neurobase) {   neurobase::ortho2(check_eb$images$p.value <= 0.05, pdim = pdim)   neurobase::ortho2(check_eb$images$adjusted_p_value <= 0.05, pdim = pdim) }

what: Running the locally moderated T statistics
title: limmi
text: run findNearestNeighbors list neighbors voxel. function nifti_local_moderated_t_stat produces moderated T statistics respect local neighbors. computation can parallelized specifying parameter mc.cores. compare locally moderated T-statistic(left) globally moderated T-statistic (right).

title: Authors and Citation
text: John Muschelli. Author, maintainer. Guoqing Wang. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Henson R, Shallice T, Gorno-Tempini M, Dolan RJ (2002). “Face repetition effects implicit explicit memory tests measured fMRI.” Cerebral Cortex, 12(2), 178–186. Muschelli J (2020). limmi: Linear Models Medical Images. R package version 0.2.0, https://github.com/muschellij2/limmi.
code: @Article{,   title = {Face repetition effects in implicit and explicit memory tests as measured by fMRI},   author = {RNA Henson and Timothy Shallice and ML Gorno-Tempini and Raymond J Dolan},   journal = {Cerebral Cortex},   volume = {12},   number = {2},   pages = {178--186},   year = {2002},   publisher = {Oxford University Press}, } @Manual{,   year = {2020},   url = {https://github.com/muschellij2/limmi},   title = {limmi: Linear Models for Medical Images},   author = {John Muschelli},   note = {R package version 0.2.0}, }

title: Linear Models for Medical Images
text: goal limmi provide functions running LIMMA medical images.

title: Linear Models for Medical Images
text: can install limmi GitHub :

what: Find the approximate set of neighbors of each voxels. — findNearestNeighbors
title: Find the approximate set of neighbors of each voxels. — findNearestNeighbors
text: Find approximate set neighborhood voxels, given distance radius.number elements neighborhood (2*radius)^3. recommend find nearest neighbors prior limma

title: Find the approximate set of neighbors of each voxels. — findNearestNeighbors
Find the approximate set of neighbors of each voxels. — findNearestNeighbors
text: maskImg Input Masked image masked voxels labeled zeros radius Integer: Indices `dist(targetInd - queryInd) <= radius` threads Integer: threads use closest point search.

title: Find the approximate set of neighbors of each voxels. — findNearestNeighbors
text: result vcgKDtree

what: Convert NIfTI data.frame to a SummarizedExperiment — nifti_df_to_SummarizedExperiment
title: Convert NIfTI data.frame to a SummarizedExperiment — nifti_df_to_SummarizedExperiment
text: Convert NIfTI data.frame SummarizedExperiment

title: Convert NIfTI data.frame to a SummarizedExperiment — nifti_df_to_SummarizedExperiment
code: nifti_df_to_SummarizedExperiment(   x,   path_column = "image",   assay_name = path_column,   template_images = NULL,   ... )

title: Convert NIfTI data.frame to a SummarizedExperiment — nifti_df_to_SummarizedExperiment
text: x optional `data.frame` describing samples/participants. path_column column `x` paths file names data.  Can also list column `x` column images assay_name Name `assay` SummarizedExperiment template_images List images annotations rows data (voxels), template mask segmentations ... additional arguments pass SummarizedExperiment

title: Convert NIfTI data.frame to a SummarizedExperiment — nifti_df_to_SummarizedExperiment
text: SummarizedExperiment output

title: Convert NIfTI data.frame to a SummarizedExperiment — nifti_df_to_SummarizedExperiment
Run `eBayes` on NIfTI Images — nifti_eBayes
text: Run `eBayes` NIfTI Images

title: Run `eBayes` on NIfTI Images — nifti_eBayes
code: nifti_eBayes(   imgs,   mask = NULL,   verbose = TRUE,   ...,   proportion = 0.01,   stdev.coef.lim = c(0.1, 4),   trend = FALSE,   robust = FALSE,   winsor.tail.p = c(0.05, 0.1),   coef = NULL,   adjust.method = "BH" )  eBayes_to_images(   fit,   mask,   verbose = TRUE,   proportion = 0.01,   stdev.coef.lim = c(0.1, 4),   trend = FALSE,   robust = FALSE,   winsor.tail.p = c(0.05, 0.1),   coef = NULL,   adjust.method = "BH" )

title: Run `eBayes` on NIfTI Images — nifti_eBayes
text: imgs List images character filenames mask Image subset data verbose Print diagnostic messages ... additional arguments pass lmFit proportion numeric value 0 1, assumed proportion voxels differentially expressed, passed eBayes stdev.coef.lim numeric vector length 2, assumed lower upper limits standard deviation log2-fold-changes differentially expressed voxels, passed eBayes trend logical, intensity-trend allowed prior variance? Default prior variance constant, passed eBayes robust logical, estimation df.prior var.prior robustified outlier sample variances, passed eBayes winsor.tail.p numeric vector length 1 2, giving left right tail proportions x Winsorize. Used robust=TRUE, passed eBayes coef column number column name specifying coefficient contrast linear model interest, passed topTable adjust.method method adjust p-value, passed topTable fit MArrayLM fitted model object produced `lmFit` `contrasts.fit`.

title: Run `eBayes` on NIfTI Images — nifti_eBayes
text: list output images `eBayes` linear fit

title: Run `eBayes` on NIfTI Images — nifti_eBayes
code: tarfile = system.file("extdata", "can.tar.gz", package = "limmi") tarfile #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/limmi/extdata/can.tar.gz" exdir = tempfile() dir.create(exdir) files = untar(tarfile = tarfile, list = TRUE, exdir = exdir) files = files[!grepl("^[.]", basename(files))] unz = untar(tarfile = tarfile, files = files, exdir = exdir) files = files[ grepl("hdr", basename(files))] files #>  [1] "con_0006.hdr" "con_0007.hdr" "con_0008.hdr" "con_0009.hdr" "con_0010.hdr" #>  [6] "con_0011.hdr" "con_0012.hdr" "con_0013.hdr" "con_0014.hdr" "con_0015.hdr" #> [11] "con_0016.hdr" "con_0017.hdr" files = file.path(exdir, files) res = nifti_eBayes(files, verbose = FALSE) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ design_mat = cbind(x1 = rep(c(0, 1), each = 6), x2 = rep(c(0, 1, 0, 1), each = 3)) res2 = nifti_eBayes(files, design = design_mat, coef = 2) } # }

what: Transform set of images to matrix — nifti_images_to_matrix
title: Transform set of images to matrix — nifti_images_to_matrix
text: Creates matrix, voxels rows images columns

title: Transform set of images to matrix — nifti_images_to_matrix
Transform set of images to matrix — nifti_images_to_matrix
text: imgs Vector files list images (niftiImage, array, nifti) mask Binary image subset voxels verbose print diagnostic messages

title: Transform set of images to matrix — nifti_images_to_matrix
text: Matrix V n, V product dimensions one image number voxels mask, n number images

title: Run `lmFit` on NIfTI Images — nifti_lmFit
text: imgs List images character filenames mask Image subset data verbose Print diagnostic messages ... additional arguments pass lmFit

title: Run `lmFit` on NIfTI Images — nifti_lmFit
text: result lmFit

title: Compute local moderated T-statistics — nifti_local_moderated_t_stat
text: Compute local moderated T-statistics

title: Compute local moderated T-statistics — nifti_local_moderated_t_stat
code: nifti_local_moderated_t_stat(   imgs,   mask = NULL,   nn,   radius,   adjust.method = "BH",   verbose = FALSE,   ... )

title: Compute local moderated T-statistics — nifti_local_moderated_t_stat
text: imgs List images character filenames mask Image subset data nn nearest-neighbors computed findNearestNeighbors radius Integer: Indices dist(targetInd - queryInd) <= radius adjust.method method adjust p-value, passed topTable verbose Print diagnostic messages ... additional arguments pass mclapply

title: Compute local moderated T-statistics — nifti_local_moderated_t_stat
text: list output images, including moderated T map, p-value map, adjusted p-value map, pseudo T map.

title: limmi 0.1.0
text: Added nifti_*, currently eBayes lmFit. Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added functions ability download data.
